amendment.description: Amendment expresses the sense of Congress that, to the greatest extent practicable, equipment and products purchased with funds made available under the bill should be American-made.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 5 in the Congressional Record of June 25, 1996, to express that it is the sense of Congress that all equipment and products purchased with funds appropriated in the bill should be made in America.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Traficant amendment (A004) Agreed to by voice vote.
